section.title: Purpose
section.p: Instead of using windows to open a document, you might find it more convenient to use a command.

refsyn.title: Format
refsyn.p: The following syntax diagram describes how you open a document from the WindowsÂ® command line. Note that lowercase letters in a parameter name are optional and need not be typed.

section.title: Parameters

plentry.pd: DOCOPENspecifies that you want to open a document.
folder specifies the name of the folder that contains the document you want to open.
document_name specifies the name of the document to be opened.
segnumber specifies the number of the segment which is to be activated when the document is opened.
linenumber specifies the line number to which the cursor is positioned when the document is opened.
searchme specifies a search string to be searched in the document, the segment containing the first occurence of the search string will be activated.

If you specify this parameter, you are not prompted with any message window. If you do not specify this parameter, a message window pops up whenever an error occurs or when the task has successfully completed.

section.note: You can type the commands in uppercase, lowercase, or in mixed-case letters. You may not use any wildcard characters, such as an asterisk (*).
